  physical_appearance: \The image shows a photograph that is in black-and-white. It is rectangular and it features a single storey building in the background. In front of the building
 four men are standing and looking in the direction where the photograph was captured. They are dressed in a variety of outfits. There are several items in the building behind them
 and the words \\Magnolia\\ can be seen pasted on a container\

  subject_terms_1: general stores workers

  subject_terms_2: Employees General stores Singapore Black-and-white photography

  subject_terms_3: Photography Coronation Road West

  sgcool_label_text: A native of Karuvakurichi village
 near Mannargudi town in Tamil Nadu
 S. Appavoo Kandiar was a general contractor specializing in pipe and cable laying
 handling of cargo and a concrete bricks supplier. Mr.Kandiar was a successful contractor; called a millionaire by the Straits Times in 1957
 he owned properties in Bukit Timah and Coronation Road areas. He was a contemporary of Indian pioneers such as P.Govindasamy Pillai
 Govindasamy Sarangapany
 Pakkirisami Pillai
 and had friendly associations with them.

metadata.title_text: Workers annex and shop at Coronation West Road, late 1940s
metadata.physical_appearance: "The image shows a photograph that is in black-and-white. It is rectangular and it features a single storey building in the background. In front of the building, four men are standing and looking in the direction where the photograph was captured. They are dressed in a variety of outfits. There are several items in the building behind them, and the words ""Magnolia"" can be seen pasted on a container"
metadata.subject_terms_2: Employees General stores Singapore Black-and-white photography
metadata.sgcool_label_text: A native of Karuvakurichi village, near Mannargudi town in Tamil Nadu, S. Appavoo Kandiar was a general contractor specializing in pipe and cable laying, handling of cargo and a concrete bricks supplier. Mr.Kandiar was a successful contractor; called a millionaire by the Straits Times in 1957, he owned properties in Bukit Timah and Coronation Road areas. He was a contemporary of Indian pioneers such as P.Govindasamy Pillai, Govindasamy Sarangapany, Pakkirisami Pillai, and had friendly associations with them.
